item.title: [GRATUIT] Thingiverse > RainingFire > 6mm_Restaurant_10___Hexed_and_Hexless [non dl]
item.description:
Source : https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:5137984

Id objet : 5137984

Collections pour tags :

 8
 9
10
11
12
13
14
15
16

**Go to the "Thing Files" tab to individually download the files - Thingiverse is giving an odd 404 error when trying to use the "Download all files" buttons**

The perfect restaurant for watching S7 broadcasts or kicking back with the local mercs for a beer. This building is designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support placing units on top in all hexes for playability. The top of version B has additional supports for two edge hexes for extra stability. It is 1 level tall in most areas, except for the front two hexes where it is 1.5 levels tall, if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are eight files. For each of version A and B, one has the building on hexes, another is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle, and there are two more versions that have the text removed from the front of the building. Using the NoText versions, you can paint custom names on the front, print off logos to attach, or leave it blank.

As always, tipping is appreciated at: paypal.me/rainingfire416

Notable features:
-An in-universe themed restaurant name.
-Fantastic custom logo and details to give it a proper BBQ joint look.
-Detailed design including doors, windows, and a detailed roof with greebles.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

The best "coffee-like" substance, imported from Trell I, is available at this small corner shop! Go check Sarna - it's real. This building is designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support placing units on top in all hexes for playability. It is 1 level tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are two versions, A and B. They are essentially mirrors of each other so that the shop doors can open to either corner of an intersection. There are eight files. For each of version A and B, one has the building on hexes, another is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle, and there are two more versions that have the text removed from the front of the building. Using the NoText versions, you can paint custom names on the front, print off logos to attach, or leave it blank.

As always, tipping is appreciated at: paypal.me/rainingfire416

**Notable features:**
-An in-universe themed restaurant name.
-Cute leaf/bean logo.
-Detailed design including doors, windows, and a detailed roof with greebles.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

item.title: [GRATUIT] Thingiverse > RainingFire > 6mm_Commercial_3___Hexed_and_Hexless [non dl]
item.description:

In the 31st century, this originally Canadian business has rebranded to be even more popular! This building is designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support placing units on top for playability. It is 2 levels tall on the higher levels and 1 level tall on the lower levels if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

This is a two part print. Part 1 of the building can be used standalone as any large commercial building if you print the version without text and a logo. Part 2 is an automotive center add-on that can be placed on either side of the main building to make it larger, as seen in the photos above.

There are six files. Two have the building sections on hexes, two are hexless so that you can print the ones that fits your playstyle, and there are two more versions of Part 1 that have the text removed from the front of the building. Using the NoText versions, you can populate your tabletop with custom commercial/big-box stores by painting names on the front or printing off logos to attach.

As always, tipping is appreciated at: paypal.me/rainingfire416

Notable features:
-Based off of a very popular Canadian business, using a similar font and building design style.
-Detailed design including large front windows, two main entrances, garage doors, windows, and bollards to protect the building from bad drivers.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

As always, tipping is appreciated at: paypal.me/rainingfire416

Notable features:
-Based off of very popular Canadian and U.S. automotive service chains.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

In the 31st century we still need hair cuts, insurance, and vision correction, and business owners still enjoy plays on words! This building is designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support placing units on top in all hexes for playability. It is 1 level tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are four files. One has the building on hexes, another is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle, and there are two more versions that have the text removed from the front of the building. The versions with text will print best in resin, so if you print with FDM you may prefer to print the NoText files or use a smaller nozzle. Using the NoText versions, you can paint custom names on the front, print off logos to attach, or leave it blank.

As always, tipping is appreciated at: paypal.me/rainingfire416

Notable features:
-Neat strip-mall design.
-Detailed design including doors, windows, rear entrances with utility boxes, and a detailed roof with greebles.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Description :

 1

 9

A radome designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. These provide great scatter terrain to add detail to your military bases. It also looks great in an open field as extra cover. The top of the B version is flat and can support a unit placed on top for playability. It is 2 levels tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are four files. One of each building both with and without hexes so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle. Remember to print the B version if you want the extra support pegs to support units on top for playability. I advise printing these in resin if possible because they are small enough that they don't take much resin, and the details show up smoother.

As always, tipping is appreciated at: paypal.me/rainingfire416

Notable features:
-This building goes perfectly with the other military buildings I've designed.
-Detailed design including entrance door, supported walkway, and radome design.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

Justification du tag SUP :

~~~
-Detailed design including entrance door, supported walkway, and radome design.
~~~

Always waiting to spring up on their enemy, this restaurant chain seems to spread all across the sphere. This building is designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support a unit placed on top for the hex locations. It is 1 level tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are four files. One has the building on hexes, another is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle, and there are two more versions that have the text removed from the front of the building. The versions with text may only look good when printed in resin, so if you print with FDM you may prefer to print the NoText files. In that case, you can paint a name on the front, print off a logo to attach, or leave it blank.

Notable features:
-Building design is based on a version of the real-world equivalent restaurant. The angled entrances in particular.
-Detailed design including doors, windows, a drive through, and a detailed roof with greebles.
-The NoText versions work perfectly well as any generic commercial building. Feel free to be creative and print off logos to decorate your city!

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

McMarik's! They're lovin' it. A restaurant chain that would be popular anywhere in the universe, this building is designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support a unit placed on top for all 7 hex locations. It is 1 level tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are four files. One has the building on hexes, another is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle, and there are two more versions that have the text removed from the front of the building. The versions with text may only look good when printed in resin, so if you print with FDM you may prefer to print the NoText files. In that case, you can paint a name on the front, print off a logo to attach, or leave it blank.

Notable features:
-Font that is clearly similar to a popular real-world burger chain.
-Giant M statue in the versions with hexes, which are great advertisements for the franchise.
-Detailed design including doors, windows, a drive through, and a detailed roof with greebles.
-The NoText versions work perfectly well as any generic commercial building. Feel free to be creative and print off logos to decorate your city!

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

item.title: [GRATUIT] Thingiverse > RainingFire > 6mm_Restaurant_2___Hexed_and_Hexless [non dl]
item.description:

Triple F Burger! The most popular fast food joint in the Federated area! This building is designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support a unit placed on top for all 4 hex locations. It is 1 level tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are eight files. Four versions of the building - on and off hexes both with and without text. Two large F statues as decorations - one on a hex and one without a hex. And two large "triple F" billboards - one on a hex and one without a hex.

The building versions with text may only look good when printed in resin, so if you print with FDM you may prefer to print the NoText files. In that case, you can paint a name on the front, print off a logo to attach, or leave it blank.

Notable features:
-Detailed design including doors, windows, drive-through window with bollards, a ladder to the roof, and a detailed roof with greebles.
-The F statue is on a small pedestal with 3 flower boxes and benches. These would look best if you flock it nicely or add miniature flowers or shrubs.
-The large F statue is 2 levels tall but will not support a unit. It is meant as a decoration. It will require a little support to print nicely.
-The billboard is also 2 levels tall and may support a unit if you are careful, but it is also meant as a decoration. It will require a little support to print nicely.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

item.title: [GRATUIT] Thingiverse > RainingFire > 6mm_Library_1B___Hexed_and_Hexless [non dl]
item.description:
Source : https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4598474

Id objet : 4598474

Prix : 0 euros

Collections :

  • epic decors IMP Bâtiments

Collections pour tags :

Description :

A library building designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support a unit placed on top for all 23 hex locations. It is 6 levels tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are two files. One has the building on hexes and the other is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle. Further, there is a second variation of this building, uploaded as “Library 1A” here: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4598463

The difference between the two buildings is that 1A is the "original" version, and for 1B the faces that extend from the side of the upper part of the building do not extend as far. If you do not print at a high enough resolution then the bottom part of those faces may sag slightly on 1A. This is not an issue if you print at a high resolution, and can clean up well if you do experience sagging, but you may choose to use 1B to speed up the print time by lowering the resolution, or because your printer resolution cannot go high enough to print those extra faces without issue. 1B makes the building design less prominent, but it means that if you print the building at a low resolution then those parts won't sag at the bottom.

Notable features:
-Detailed design including doors, windows, loading docks, steps to an exterior walkway around the building, and a detailed roof area with greebles such as ducting.
-Visually interesting exterior design.
-The second floor has a curved wall supporting the larger floors on the upper part of the building. This means that the building should print without any supports, and conveniently it is also how the real life building is designed.
-This building is closely based on a real life building. It is designed as a library, but you could use it as an office building or something else if you're creative.
-This building is fairly large and would provide a great addition to your urban terrain.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

A mixed use building designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support a unit placed on top for all 7 hex locations. It is 2 levels tall if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are two files. One has the building on hexes and the other is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle. Further, there is a second variation of this building, uploaded as “Mixed Use Building 2A” here: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4598418

The difference between the two buildings is that 2B has simplified windows and slightly different placement of the windows around the building. This provides you with different versions of the same building that you can use to vary the look of your terrain.

Notable features:
-Detailed design including doors, windows, and a detailed roof area with greebles such as ducting.
-This building is designed as a mixed use building, meaning that the ground floor could be commercial retail space while the upper floors are used as apartments. Of course, you can use the building as whatever you'd like, and you could even use it as a manufacturing facility, storage facility, or something else if you're creative.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.

An office tower designed to be 3D printed as terrain for 6mm tabletop gaming. The top of the building is large and flat enough to support a unit placed on top for all 14 hex locations. It is 4 levels tall on the shorter section and 6 levels tall on the taller section if you're playing a specific mecha tabletop game.

There are two files. One has the building on hexes and the other is hexless so that you can print the one that fits your playstyle. Further, there are second and third variations of this building, uploaded as “Office Tower 3A” and "Office Tower 3C" here:

3A: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4598329
3C: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4598327

The difference between the three buildings is that the two tower sections of 3A are only 4 levels tall, and for 3C both tower sections are 6 levels tall.

Notable features:
-Detailed design including doors, windows, steps to a raised platform around the building, and a roof with ducting.

The model units are in mm and it is scaled such that the hexes are 33mm from flat-to-flat, which is perfect for modern hex maps using 33mm hexes. You can always resize it if your hexes are slightly smaller/larger.

Please post pictures and leave feedback if you make this yourself! I'd love to see prints and use the feedback to adjust overhangs, detail levels, etc. on this model and future ones as well.
